alert.note: Alert for York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:30AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, in east central Virginia, Charles City and New Kent. In southeast Virginia, City of Hampton, City of Newport News, City of Poquoson, City of Williamsburg, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 228 AM EST, VDOT reported flooding in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but little to no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Williamsburg, Queens Lake, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, College Of William And Mary, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Christopher Newport University, Norge, Toano, Langley AFB, Hampton University, Northampton, Grove, Busch Gardens, Lee Hall, Carver Gardens and York Terrace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
